page.title: 13 FIELD HOUSE FARM, THIRTLEBY
page.content: Field House Farm in Thirtleby is owned by Mr. Richardson. It is a very big farm, about the biggest in Thirtleby with buildings on both sides of the road. The farm has geese, pigs, horses and bullocks. One tractor would cost Â£12,000. A combine harvester would cost about Â£35,000. Mr.Richardson, the farmer, gets up at 6.00a.m. He goes to let his bullocks and his horses out of the barn were they have spent the night. He feeds them and then he goes to check the pigs and feeds them. Before his stock of pigs went down he used to use 1ton of pigfood. He has about 15 geese on the farm and at Christmas the Richardson family eat one of them for dinner.
